name: Bob Was Hungry
description: Bob Was Hungry is a challenging precision platformer with many levels designed to truly test your platforming skills. Play alone or online with 2-8 player co-op and make your way through countless perils to feed your bob!
minimum_requirements: İşletim Sistemi: Windows 7 İşlemci: Intel Core i5 1.8 GHz Bellek: 4 GB RAM Ekran Kartı: 768 MB / Shader Model 2.0 DirectX: Sürüm 9.0c Depolama: 1 GB kullanılabilir alan

reviews.review_text: Very, VERY underrated game. Support the developers by buying it they're like broke after releasing it because not enough people bought it because they're blind or something buy it please ill kiss you

Formal stuff:  Bob Was Hungry is skill-needed platform that put you in role of some alien thingy called ¨Bob¨ which needs to be feed with all variety of food, however to get to it he must pass lot's of obstacles.   Graphic :  Is beautiful and enjoyable to the eye, It surely brings refreshment to platformer titles.  Sound :  Music is cool and energetic that follow's the gameplay.  Gameplay :  Game will require from you to sharpen your platforming skills before you can beat the game, nevertheless even if you suck at it you will enjoy it.  Tutorial is very helpful so it is recommended to be played. Controls are simple and wont give any hard time to beginers. Level design's are beautiful same as they are challenging.   Random sentances: This game is firstborn child of father Super Meat Boy and mother Speedrunners. Single player is fun, but full potential lies in multiplayer up to 8 people! It will give you a damn much fun. There is maybe possibility that you can broke joystick or keyboard playing it. :D Didnt encounter any bugs or glitches, and game runs smooth.  Highly recommended to platform lovers, and gamers that are looking for challenging game.  Ok, enough of me, now go out there and have fun.    Game on, ZemunBRE

I played a ton of the Demo, so when I saw it was so cheap I snagged it. I really like this game. It really plays and feels like Super Meat Boy, which is a good thing. I really love the visuals and the soundtrack, everythings really pretty, and the sounds are awesome.  EDIT: Meant to put my gripes with the game, sorry. The only thing I don't like about the game is that it can get a tad bit repetitive.   Overall, I really love this. Totally worth your time. 10/10

Finally someone made a good precision platformer... The last one was Super Meat boy. And boy mixing this with the co-op mode made this game even better. I got a lot of laughs playing it with my friend in the hard mode. We just finished cave in normal, just imagine it in the hard mode give us chills.  I buyed it with 95% discount, but this game is worth even without the discount.  10/10 Would die again.

PREPARE YOURSELF BEFORE PLAYING THIS GAME BECAUSE :  BOB IS EXTREMELY HUNGRY BOB IS AUTISM BOB IS MASOCHIST BOB IS ROUND SHAPED SHIIT BOB IS CRAZY BOB IS STUPID BOB IS SUCKS BOB IS A NIGHTMARE!!!!!!!!!!

Bob Was Hungry is a 2.5d platformer that is quite similar to Super Meat Boy, and even references it in one of it's levels. There's a wide variety of terrains Bob must cross, in order to get his food. With, or without condiments. I have played through some of the game, but I decided to give the ILs a shot, and with that there are many different tricks you can use to optimize your time!  Bob Was Hungry is a nice addition to Shorebound Studios' already neat game collection, and I'd recommend to anybody who enjoys difficult platforming! 9.5/10

Very fun platformer/puzzle game. Worth buying if it is on sale. You'll have a good few hours of fun for around $2. I would avoid for the full price, however. If you have ever played red ball on mobile and enjoyed it, you will definitely like this game. If you haven't check out the mobile game first and get a feel for this genre of game, then buy.
I tried my best and my best wasn't good enough.

Having played and enjoyed multiple 'hardcore' platformers like Mr Bree, giana sisters, etc, I had high hopes for this game. Unfortunately it didn't deliver. This game has basically no story, and has you play ~ 20 levels on 5 worlds. Its a platformer where you navigate around traps and die with one touch. This would be fine, but then the problems set it. Each level has you begin from start if you get touched, with no checkpoints. Games like this should utilize checkpoints, and ones that don't only do it to force increased playtime and cause frustration thats supposed to be fun but its really just lazy game design. If you navigate a really hard precise section or 2, then die at a part you haven't seen yet, you shouldn't have to play those first 2 sections, thats just dumb bc you've beaten them. The problems escalate when the devs choose to instead of making different, varied traps with different difficulty, they constantly force more precise and perfect jumps, forcing you to do ~4 different sections all with tiny gaps and spikes and traps on all squares except 1, which is just a sign of laziness. Some levels where its 14 seconds it ok to have no checkppoints, but others that are 45 seconds its stupid. The other problem is they start forcing you to do levels where everything is single crumbling blocks, not letting you plan moves or have down time between things, so that 1 mistimed jump the whole level is over. Then later on in a really dumb decision they make you start collecting things all over the level to beat the level, some of which are up in weird corners surrounded by traps you would normally not have to go to. Collecting should only be optional, but once again its designed to force you to fail. In other levels the lack of clarity on where you should go screws you. On 1 level I hit a switch and could go backwards or continue along and up, with no idea, and since this was late in the level, it kept screwing me bc I didn't know the right way to go. This is bc some paths are to optional collectibles, which shouldn't be the case, as they should just be along the way or clearly visible. Other parts throw things together like crumbling blocks and shots coming at you from off the screen. These parts are super stupid because they are all about chance and timing. You have to jump to the next blocks hoping the shot isn't there and if so you're screwed. It just about what time you jumped on the first of all the crumbling blocks, and you can potentially be screwed from the start, which is just dumb because you can't do anything about it.   All this precision and forced repetition wouldn't be so bad if the controls weren't off. They aren't terrible but they need to be better for what the game asks. Your guy is a ball, and instead of moving along regularly, he rolls in short abrupt bursts, and not in a steady rhythm. When stuck between things and moving with them, this can screw you. When jumping, the platforming is floaty. The biggest problem is he accelerates to the side super quickly. you will pres over and jump a little without the sprint button, and he will go flying to the side, forcing you to hold back. This leads to multiple deaths and is imprecise. Other times you will land on a single block and bounce off, or slide off. This leads controls to feel slippery. This also occurs when trying to wall jump off blocks or walls. The hitboxes are off many times too, as you will be slightly below something and it still counts as you getting hit. The other problem is how imprecise the jumps can be. You will press jump the same way multiple times, and some times you'll go up a little bit, and other times you'll go to high and hit into something. Things only get worse in the later levels, and instead of changing things up it just requires more perfect jumping and tons of it in a row or start it all over again. with the finnicky imprecise controls it just becomes frustrating for the sake of it, and at least 50% of the time it doesn't feel like your fault you died.   Go get one of the games listed above or many other good ones on steam instead of this.   3.5/10.
Genuinely fun. A real challenge for you, and your friends. It's rather unfortunate that it can't host more people.
Can be super frustrating, but tons of fun, especially with friends. Took me longer to beat this game than many AAA games I've played. Could (and have) played this game for hours upon hours straight.
